    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/things-were-way-tougher-charlie-150000169.html

    81.25% Shortened!

    When interest rates increase, the spread of a bank’s earnings widens

    Last summer, Bank of America boosted its quarterly dividend by 5% to 22 cents per share — and that’s after the company’s 17% dividend increase in July 2021

    At the current share price, the bank offers an annual yield of 2.5%

    Buffett likes the company, too, as Bank of America happens to be the second-largest holding at Berkshire Hathaway

    In Q3 of 2022, the Chinese tech company grew its revenue by 3% from a year ago to $29.1 billion

    16, 2022, the company has repurchased approximately $18 billion of its own shares under its existing $25 billion share repurchase program

    ['stock', 'munger', 'year', 'share', 'bank']

  • MALAYSIA MAY REDUCE DEPENDENCE ON ZII JIA AT MIXED TEAM CHAMPIONSHIP

    https://www.thestar.com.my/sport/badminton/2023/02/04/malaysia-may-reduce-dependence-on-zii-jia-at-mixed-team-championship

    02/04/2023, 08:08

    72.73% Shortened!

    He said they would use the rotation system in fielding players, especially in singles where apart from Zii Jia, a second player, Leong Jun Hao, had also been selected to represent the country

    As Zii Jia and Jun Hao have not been performing well lately, Choong Hann wants to use the centralised training camp next week to whip them into top shape, especially in terms of shuttle control and tactics

    Zii Jia had a disappointing start to 2023 when he crashed out in the early rounds of the Malaysian Open, India Open and Indonesian Masters while Jun Hao suffered a similar fate in the qualifying round of the Thailand Masters, losing 22-24, 19-21 to teammate Yeoh Seong Zoe

    At the Asia Mixed Team Championships, Malaysia will also be relying on world men’s doubles champions Aaron Chia-Soh Wooi Yik, top women’s doubles pair Pearly Tan-M

    Asked about India, who are considered Malaysia’s main threat in Group B, Choong Hann believed his team could win if they managed to handle the pressure on court

    Asia Mixed Team Championships

    ['zii', 'jia', 'open', 'india', 'malaysia']

  • SEEING RED AT GREEN ZONE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/04/seeing-red-at-green-zone

    02/04/2023, 08:08

    80.65% Shortened!

    The closure of the department’s green zone, which started early yesterday morning and extended for a period of about seven hours, was due to a shortage of staff and a high patient load

    “The Emergency Department is dealing with an overwhelming patient load at the moment, and they need to be given close attention

    “For this period, we need to prioritise critical and terminal cases

    “The patient load was heavy, and the green zone was piling up with non-critical cases

    It is also learnt that a new shift system will be imposed starting next week to accommodate the high patient load, where off days and night offs are subjected to the number of days a medical staff member works on a night shift

    “If the situation persists, many more medical staff will quit and the healthcare system will be affected,” Farhin said

    ['department', 'staff', 'hospital', 'patient', 'say']

    “For this period, we need to prioritise critical and terminal cases

  • LATE-NIGHT CHATS WITH JHO LOW BROUGHT UP IN COURT

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/04/late-night-chats-with-jho-low-brought-up-in-court

    02/04/2023, 08:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    She was referring to text messages brought up by Najib’s lead counsel Tan Sri Muhammad Shafee Abdullah at Najib’s trial involving the misappropriation of RM2.3bil of 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) funds, Bernama reported

    Muhammad Shafee said that according to the chats, Low texted to Yu that “Mr Cheah (then AmBank managing director) is leaving the board at the end of this month and we don’t have access to the account holder

    “I was asked to close the accounts by Ashok

    It was just a conversation that we had in the bank,” said the 41st prosecution witness

    The witness also disagreed with Muhammad Shafee’s suggestion that she was complicit with Low in working to cover up the goings-on with the accounts

    The lawyer then moved on to Yu’s purported reasons for her termination, stating that one of the reasons for her being fired was that she had obtained approval from a third party, namely Low, in relation to Najib’s accounts

    ['account', 'najib', 'low', 'muhammad', 'shafee']

  • COURT DENIES ZAHID'S REQUEST FOR PERMANENT PASSPORT ACCESS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/04/court-denies-zahids-request-for-permanent-passport-access

    02/04/2023, 08:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    Justice Sequerah said one of the bail conditions was for the accused to surrender his passport to the court

    Justice Sequerah said the court, however, took cognisance of the fact that Ahmad Zahid, as a Deputy Prime Minister and the Rural and Regional Development Minister, has official duties to perform

    The court allowed Ahmad Zahid to have temporary access to his passport for the purpose of applying for a diplomatic passport

    Following this, Ahmad Zahid would have to return his passport to the court

    On Jan 20, Ahmad Zahid filed the application for the permanent release of his passport, which he said was done bona fide (with good intentions) so that he could perform his official duties

    Ahmad Zahid stated that he needed the passport returned because he was required to travel outside of the country as part of his duties, and that it would also assist him in applying for a diplomatic passport for official travel

    ['ahmad', 'zahid', 'passport', 'duty', 'court']

    The court allowed Ahmad Zahid to have temporary access to his passport for the purpose of applying for a diplomatic passport

    All police personnel must understand the Constitution

    Now when the dress code issue was brought to public attention, he is keeping quiet

    In this day and age, the police system should be linked in every station, so that we do not have to run around from one police station to another to make reports

    But a police station is a public establishment supported by taxpayers’ money

    We should not be telling people how to dress

    Are there too many of them now? They should be curtly reprimanded and told to focus on their police work

    But Arteta is convinced Jorginho's leadership will be a priceless asset in a critical month for Arsenal's thrilling title chase

    Maybe they don’t have experience, maybe they are too young, maybe he’s not that well-known or whatever

    “With the latest news on Mo's injury, we needed a player in that position and Jorginho is someone I have always admired, a great character and someone who is going to bring leadership quality

    “He is going to help the team a lot with his intelligence, his personality and the way he understands our way of playing – he is a player that will fit in really well with what we want to do

    “From the bottom of my heart, I hope they can turn this around in the best possible way because everybody who has feelings for Everton knows they are unique, very special and they deserve the best

    80.65% Shortened!

    For one devotee, 32-year-old J

    On Jan 31, Sugumaran managed to fulfill his vow and carried the kavadi up to the Sri Subramaniar Swamy Temple in Batu Caves

    Sugumaran said it took him about 25 minutes to carry the kavadi - which weighed about 45kg - up to the temple

    Sivakumar told CNA that up to 2 million people will be expected to throng the temple grounds this year, including tourists from all over the world

    “This year’s celebrations will be very big

    Those who couldn’t perform their prayers last year will do it this year,” he said, adding that the largest crowds are expected this weekend

  • COMMENTARY: HOW AN OBSCURE US FIRM PROFITED FROM TRIGGERING INDIAN GIANT ADANI'S PLUNGING STOCK PRICES

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/commentary/adani-group-stock-price-short-sell-legal-3251786

    02/04/2023, 06:08

    89.83% Shortened!

    What complicates this report is that Hindenburg Research isn’t just a research company

    It’s an “activist short seller”, with a financial incentive in seeing Adani’s stock price fall

    Short selling (also known as having a short exposure, or shorting) is essentially betting on a company’s stock falling

    The most common is to sell borrowed stock

    They then sell that stock, banking the proceeds

    Investors can short sell a bond like they would a stock

    ['short', 'hindenburg', 'adani', 'stock', 'company']

    What complicates this report is that Hindenburg Research isn’t just a research company

    It’s an “activist short seller”, with a financial incentive in seeing Adani’s stock price fall

    Short selling (also known as having a short exposure, or shorting) is essentially betting on a company’s stock falling

    The most common is to sell borrowed stock

    They then sell that stock, banking the proceeds

    Investors can short sell a bond like they would a stock

    ['short', 'hindenburg', 'adani', 'stock', 'company']

    But the economy is not running too hot, and BlackRock sees rate hikes pushing the economy into a recession

    That’s why investors may want to check out recession-proof sectors — like consumer staples

    While most collect wine for enjoyment rather than investment, bottles of fine wine become rarer and potentially more valuable as time goes by

    As a real asset, fine wine can also provide the diversification you need to protect your portfolio against the volatile effects of inflation and recession

    It may seem counterintuitive to have real estate on this list

  • HOW MUCH MONEY DO I NEED TO LIVE ENTIRELY OFF DIVIDENDS? HERE'S HOW TO FIGURE OUT THE LOWEST AMOUNT YOU NEED TO MAKE IT WORK

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/much-money-live-entirely-off-150000439.html

    82.86% Shortened!

    And so much depends on the kind of life you plan to lead in retirement

    Why does this matter? If you consider wealth relative, you’ll want to generate more money in passive income, or just enough, compared to others in your age group

    With forecasting how much dividend income you can safely expect, historical numbers provide a reliable barometer

    Close the gap with whatever retirement income you already have and if the number is lower than that $100,000 — say, just $10,000 — you’ll be in better shape to experience dividend-derived freedom

    Since 2018, the fund’s median dividend yield has been 2.97%

    That means you’d need just $3,367,003 to generate $100,000 in passive income annually

    ['dividend', 'much', 'retirement', 'passive', 'income']

    And so much depends on the kind of life you plan to lead in retirement

    Why does this matter? If you consider wealth relative, you’ll want to generate more money in passive income, or just enough, compared to others in your age group

    With forecasting how much dividend income you can safely expect, historical numbers provide a reliable barometer

    Close the gap with whatever retirement income you already have and if the number is lower than that $100,000 — say, just $10,000 — you’ll be in better shape to experience dividend-derived freedom

    Since 2018, the fund’s median dividend yield has been 2.97%

    That means you’d need just $3,367,003 to generate $100,000 in passive income annually

    ['dividend', 'much', 'retirement', 'passive', 'income']

    Average hourly earnings increased 0.3%, as expected, down from the 0.4% in the prior month, while the unemployment rate of 3.4% was the lowest since 1969

    The STOXX index closed with a 1.23% gain on the week, its highest closing level since April 21

    MSCI's index was on track for a second straight weekly advance even with Friday's tumble

    12, as the dollar index rose 1.149% and the euro was down 1.02% to $1.0799

    Personal finance author and radio host Dave Ramsey criticized the trend on The Ramsey Show, calling it “a trainwreck.” “So, let me get this straight

    Chances are good you're overpaying for home insurance

    “The problem is you’ve got debt, you’re not earning enough money and you’re not doing enough to go out and change it

    If you are planning to buy instead of rent when you move out, experts generally recommend saving 20% of the home’s purchase price for the down payment, however this can be challenging for many first-timers, especially as home prices continue to rise

  • WARREN BUFFETT’S RIGHT-HAND MAN CHARLIE MUNGER, WHO ONCE CALLED CRYPTO ‘RAT POISON,’ SAYS WE SHOULD FOLLOW CHINA’S LEAD AND BAN CRYPTOCURRENCIES ALTOGETHER

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/warren-buffett-hand-man-charlie-181131653.html

    64.71% Shortened!

    Charlie Munger is no fan of crypto

    should follow the example of China—which famously banned cryptocurrencies in 2021—and pass laws that prevent both crypto trading and the formation of new cryptocurrencies

    do after a ban of cryptocurrencies is in place?” Munger went on to say

    But the second precedent Munger offered was an odd one for a man who has amassed a net worth of $2.3 billion largely through Berkshire Hathaway, which invests in public markets

    Munger pointed to England’s ban of public trading in new common stocks after the South Sea Bubble blew up in 1720 as an example of the benefits of cracking down on risky speculation from investors

    The South Sea Bubble, which has been called the “the world’s first financial crash,” began in 1711, when The South Sea Company was founded by an act of parliament as a public-private partnership to help reduce the cost of England’s national debt

    ['munger', 'cryptocurrencies', 'call', 'say', 'ban']

    Friday, 03 Feb 2023

    "The first meeting of the Fiscal Policy Committee this year emphasises that the government will take a responsible approach in drafting Budget 2023 which will prioritise prudent drivers of economic growth and equitable development based on social justice for Malaysians

    Anwar, who is also the Finance Minister, said for 2022, the government's debts and liabilities were almost at RM1.5 trillion or over 80% of the country's GDP with a debt service ratio that is expected to be over 15% of revenue

    "Global growth is also expected to be moderate for 2023

    The Budget 2023, said Anwar, would reflect the unity government's responsibility in prioritising growth, equitable distribution and social justice

    The budget, he added, would also increase development spending to encourage inclusive development, especially in the strengthening of government services and rural infrastructure

    For the first time, many MPs, including Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim, did not wear a necktie during the Dec 20 meeting

    "However, after many made their purchases, in April last year, the company suddenly closed their application without any reason

    "This was also compounded by a statement by a former (Malaysian) minister who claimed that this company and investments were legal," he added

    (Bloomberg) -- From Intel Corp

    and Samsung Electronics Co

    The Taiwanese company overtook Intel as the leading producer of advanced logic chips and pulled in almost $13 billion more in revenue than its US rival

    in the memory-chip business

    In the chip industry, leadership isn’t just measured in market share and revenue

    Analysts estimate Intel’s revenue will be about $51 billion this year, indicating its budget will be much smaller than either TSMC or Samsung’s

    ['intel', 'company', 'samsung', 'chip', 'tsmc']

    60.0% Shortened!

    Friday, 03 Feb 2023

    A video of the incident has since gone viral

    Dang Wangi OCPD Asst Comm Noor Dellhan Yahaya said police had taken note of the one-minute, 43-second video, which was uploaded to TikTok on Thursday (Feb 2)

    "The video showed a man throwing liquor bottles from a balcony of an apartment onto a nearby expressway

    The police are in the midst of tracking down the individual responsible, he said

    "Those with information can contact the Dang Wangi district police headquarters at 03-2600 2222 or the KL police hotline at 03-2115 9999 or any nearest police station."

    Moreover, there have been injury problems for Mane

  • US, JAPAN AND NETHERLANDS IN A SQUISHY CHINA CHIP BAN

    https://asiatimes.com/2023/02/us-japan-and-netherlands-in-a-squishy-china-chip-ban/

    02/03/2023, 18:07

    80.0% Shortened!

    But implementation of what? The Wall Street Journal reported that ASML of the Netherlands and Nikon of Japan would stop exporting “at least some immersion lithography machines” to China

    These are made only by ASML and, at the request of the US government, not exported to China

    Almost certainly, analysts say, this was accomplished by using ASML or Nikon equipment

    China’s Shanghai Micro Electronics Equipment Co (SMEE) has reportedly developed lithography equipment that works down to 14nm

    The latter two companies, the largest American and Japanese makers of semiconductor production equipment, would also lose sales if lithography equipment exports to China were barred

    Japanese semiconductor production equipment makers say they have not yet been contacted by government officials about any new restrictions on exports to China

    ['china', 'semiconductor', 'say', 'would', 'asml']

    Lee is a seasoned executive with strong leadership qualities and a proven track record during his career at IJM, including overseeing the group’s growth strategies

    We look forward to continued operational and financial success under Lee's leadership as the group enters the next chapter in its 40-year history,” Tan added.

  • JOHOR SULTAN SAYS FATWA BARRING MUSLIMS FROM OTHER FAITHS’ RITUALS NOT AGAINST ‘BANGSA JOHOR’ CONCEPT

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/03/johor-sultan-says-fatwa-barring-muslims-from-other-faiths-rituals-not-against-bangsa-johor-concept/53277

    02/03/2023, 18:06

    64.71% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise JOHOR BARU, Feb 3 ― Johor’s Sultan Ibrahim Iskandar today said the new fatwa against Muslim participation in the other faiths’ rituals would not alter the racial and religious diversity espoused in the “Bangsa Johor” concept

    He explained that the fatwa the Johor Islamic Religious Council issued yesterday did not conflict with the state’s inter-faith values of tolerance, unity and understanding, adding that Johor would always respect multiracialism and religious diversity

    “The fatwa only prohibits Muslims from taking part in other religious rituals

    It is a guideline for them

    He was commenting on to the fatwa that some saw as restricting Johor’s progressive values as it did not differentiate between religious acts, cultural events and folklore

    He said this is based on Sultan Ibrahim’s consent to the fatwa

    ['johor', 'say', 'fatwa', 'muslim', 'faith']

    About Us Advertise JOHOR BARU, Feb 3 ― Johor’s Sultan Ibrahim Iskandar today said the new fatwa against Muslim participation in the other faiths’ rituals would not alter the racial and religious diversity espoused in the “Bangsa Johor” concept

    He explained that the fatwa the Johor Islamic Religious Council issued yesterday did not conflict with the state’s inter-faith values of tolerance, unity and understanding, adding that Johor would always respect multiracialism and religious diversity

    “The fatwa only prohibits Muslims from taking part in other religious rituals

    It is a guideline for them

    He was commenting on to the fatwa that some saw as restricting Johor’s progressive values as it did not differentiate between religious acts, cultural events and folklore

    He said this is based on Sultan Ibrahim’s consent to the fatwa

    About Us Advertise PORT DICKSON, Feb 3 ― Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has confirmed that the development allowance for Members of Parliament (MPs) has been reduced to RM1.3 million from RM3.8 million

    “This allowance is the development allocations of MPs coordinated by the District and Land Office, and State Development Officer, (being reduced) due to economic constraints

    Earlier, the prime minister mingled with the people and ate rojak and Chinese fried rice

    He was accompanied by Defence Minister Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan and Negeri Sembilan Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Aminuddin Harun

    “I know the community, state government officers and political leaders in Port Dickson

    Glad to meet old friends, and the rojak pasembur tastes good,” said the former Port Dickson MP

  • TWITTER SHUTS DOWN FREE ACCESS TO API, HUNDREDS OF FREE SERVICES MAY BE AFFECTED

    https://www.thestar.com.my/tech/tech-news/2023/02/03/twitter-shuts-down-free-access-to-api

    02/03/2023, 17:07

    72.73% Shortened!

    With the interface access, a system of useful apps and services developed in recent years

    "Starting February 9, we will no longer support free access to the Twitter API, both v2 and v1.1

    With the interface access, a system of useful apps and services developed in recent years

    Twitter charging for access to its interfaces could mean the services will need to demand money from their users

    Twitter is trying to make more money with a subscription offer, among other things

    After a rule change, apps from other providers that could be used to access Twitter stopped working from one day to the next

    ['interface', 'access', 'apps', 'service', 'twitter']

  • 2023 AUDI RS E-TRON GT SEEN UNDISGUISED IN MALAYSIA BEFORE Q2 LAUNCH - 598 PS, 830 NM, 487 KM EV RANGE - PAULTAN.ORG

    https://paultan.org/2023/02/03/2023-audi-rs-e-tron-gt-spotted-undisguised-in-malaysia-ahead-of-launch/

    02/03/2023, 17:07

    53.85% Shortened!

    PHS Automotive Malaysia’s (PHSAM), which is the official distributor of Audi vehicles in the country, previously announced that it would introduce a range of e-tron electric vehicles and has already begun accepting registrations of interest

    The 2022 World Performance Car of the Year first made its debut back in 2021 and is based on the J1 platform that is also used by the Porsche Taycan

    Besides the RS e-tron GT, PHSAM will also offer the standard e-tron GT quattro that also has a dual-motor setup, albeit providing 476 PS (469 hp or 350 kW) and 630 Nm, or 530 PS (523 hp or 390 kW) when boost mode is engaged

    We don’t have Malaysian pricing just yet, but in Germany, the e-tron GT quattro starts from 104,000 euros (RM483,172), while the RS e-tron GT is from 142,500 euros (RM666,184)

    With current EV incentives in play, how much do you think Audi’s electric sportback will retail for when it is launched here?     People love dream cars just like this Audi Add a comment

    ['audi', 'car', 'comment', 'tron', 'also']

    PHS Automotive Malaysia’s (PHSAM), which is the official distributor of Audi vehicles in the country, previously announced that it would introduce a range of e-tron electric vehicles and has already begun accepting registrations of interest

    The 2022 World Performance Car of the Year first made its debut back in 2021 and is based on the J1 platform that is also used by the Porsche Taycan

    Besides the RS e-tron GT, PHSAM will also offer the standard e-tron GT quattro that also has a dual-motor setup, albeit providing 476 PS (469 hp or 350 kW) and 630 Nm, or 530 PS (523 hp or 390 kW) when boost mode is engaged

    We don’t have Malaysian pricing just yet, but in Germany, the e-tron GT quattro starts from 104,000 euros (RM483,172), while the RS e-tron GT is from 142,500 euros (RM666,184)

    With current EV incentives in play, how much do you think Audi’s electric sportback will retail for when it is launched here?   • MAA PRESIDENT AISHAH AHMAD DIES IN JEDDAH

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/03/maa-president-aishah-ahmad-dies-in-jeddah/53269

    02/03/2023, 17:07

    50.0% Shortened!

    “Aishah was a legend and one of the leading automotive personalities who devoted the best years of her life contributing to the growth and development of the Malaysian automotive industry with her vision, dedication, and passion

    Aishah had helmed MAA since 1991 (when MAA was known as the Malaysian Motor Traders Association or MMTA) and spearheaded the growth of MAA into the leading automotive industry association in Malaysia

    Aishah had also been the chairman of the Automotive Federation Malaysia (AFM) since 1998

    MAA said Aishah also served as president of the Asean Automotive Federation (AAF) for three terms, 2000-2002, 2008-2010, and 2015-2017

    “During Datuk Aishah’s presidency in 2015-2017, the AAF successfully managed to recruit the Automotive Association of Myanmar (AAM) and Cambodia Automotive Industry Federation (CAIF) as members, thus bringing the complete 10 ASEAN member states industry associations into AAF,” it said

    Aishah had over 40 years of experience in the automotive industry, making her one of the longest serving individuals involved in the industry

    ['automotive', 'association', 'maa', 'aishah', 'say']

    “Aishah was a legend and one of the leading automotive personalities who devoted the best years of her life contributing to the growth and development of the Malaysian automotive industry with her vision, dedication, and passion

    Aishah had helmed MAA since 1991 (when MAA was known as the Malaysian Motor Traders Association or MMTA) and spearheaded the growth of MAA into the leading automotive industry association in Malaysia

    Aishah had also been the chairman of the Automotive Federation Malaysia (AFM) since 1998

    MAA said Aishah also served as president of the Asean Automotive Federation (AAF) for three terms, 2000-2002, 2008-2010, and 2015-2017

    “During Datuk Aishah’s presidency in 2015-2017, the AAF successfully managed to recruit the Automotive Association of Myanmar (AAM) and Cambodia Automotive Industry Federation (CAIF) as members, thus bringing the complete 10 ASEAN member states industry associations into AAF,” it said

    Aishah had over 40 years of experience in the automotive industry, making her one of the longest serving individuals involved in the industry

    ['automotive', 'association', 'maa', 'aishah', 'say']



  • KL-FOUNDLING HASHIMAH FINALLY GETS BLUE MYKAD AFTER 40 YEARS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/03/kl-foundling-hashimah-finally-gets-blue-mykad-after-40-years/53272

    02/03/2023, 17:07

    68.42% Shortened!

    I can get government hospital benefits, look for a new job, and travel if I want to,” Hashimah, dressed in a bright blue top, told reporters as she showed off her new identity card in blue that indicated her Malaysian citizenship

    I wouldn’t have this, if I didn't know the two of them,” she said, pointing to her MyKad and citizenship papers again

    Having undergone an arduous struggle to be recognised as Malaysian, Hashimah said she would like to help others who have similarly been abandoned in the country gain citizenship here if that were their wish

    “I want to help them

    “So if there’s anything I can help, I will help,” she said

    Hashimah was awarded her Malaysian citizenship on November 17 last year by the High Court, which ordered the NRD to issue her a citizenship certificate and a Malaysian identification card.

    ['abandon', 'hashimah', 'one', 'blue', 'citizenship']

  • TELCO SOURCE REFUTES DNB'S CLAIM THAT TELCOS CHOOSE WHEN AND WHERE 5G WILL BE AVAILABLE

    https://soyacincau.com/2023/02/03/telco-source-refutes-dnb-claim-telcos-choose-when-and-where-5g-available-in-malaysia/

    02/03/2023, 17:07

    57.14% Shortened!

    DNB says it has delivered integrated sites which are ready to be onboarded by telcos and the timing is dependent on the mobile network operators (MNO)

    DNB added that it is up to the MNOs to decide which sites and when they intend to onboard before it can be accessed by consumers for 5G services

    It involves a configuration on DNB’s Radio Access Network (RAN) equipment and the MNOs would have done the preconfiguration for them to onboard

    Recently, Communications and Digital Minister Fahmi Fadzil has scrutinised DNB’s claim of achieving close to 50% 5G population coverage by the end of 2022 as the MCMC has not yet verified the info

    It aims to achieve 80% 5G population coverage by the end of 2024

    Maxis has decided to postpone its decision on the 5G access agreement with DNB until the government completes its review into the 5G single wholesale network model.

    ['dnb', 'site', 'onboarding', 'telco', 'network']

    DNB says it has delivered integrated sites which are ready to be onboarded by telcos and the timing is dependent on the mobile network operators (MNO)

    DNB added that it is up to the MNOs to decide which sites and when they intend to onboard before it can be accessed by consumers for 5G services

    It involves a configuration on DNB’s Radio Access Network (RAN) equipment and the MNOs would have done the preconfiguration for them to onboard

    Recently, Communications and Digital Minister Fahmi Fadzil has scrutinised DNB’s claim of achieving close to 50% 5G population coverage by the end of 2022 as the MCMC has not yet verified the info

    It aims to achieve 80% 5G population coverage by the end of 2024

    Maxis has decided to postpone its decision on the 5G access agreement with DNB until the government completes its review into the 5G single wholesale network model.

    ['dnb', 'site', 'onboarding', 'telco', 'network']



  • MAA PRESIDENT AISHAH AHMAD PASSES AWAY

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/03/maa-president-aishah-ahmad-passes-away

    02/03/2023, 16:08

    45.45% Shortened!

    Friday, 03 Feb 2023

    MAA said Aishah, who was MAA president since 2000, would be laid to rest in Saudi Arabia on Friday (Feb 3)

    "Under her stewardship, the MAA had grown in terms of stature, memberships, and resources

    With her leadership and strong commitment, the association has engaged in numerous dialogues, discussions and proposals with the government to resolve industrial issues and review policies to support the expansion and sustenance of automotive industry in Malaysia," MAA said in a statement.

    Malaysian Automotive Association (MAA)

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['feb', 'malaysian', 'association', 'maa', 'president']

    Friday, 03 Feb 2023

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/03/challenging-1mdb-prosecution-witness-defence-tells-court-ambank-sacked-her-for-sharing-najibs-private-account-info-with-jho-low/53260

    02/03/2023, 16:07

    76.92% Shortened!

    Yu was AmBank’s relationship manager at that time and in charge of the politician’s account

    Shafee focused on previous BlackBerry Messenger (BBM) chats Yu had with Low close to midnight on December 4, 2014, where she had suggested to Low for Najib’s accounts with AmBank to be closed

    In those BBM messages in December 2014, she explained to Low that this was because Cheah Tek Kuang was leaving AmBank’s board by the end of the month and the bank would not have any direct access to the account holder Najib, and that Cheah’s replacement Ashok Ramamurthy would be updating Bank Negara Malaysia, AmBank’s chief risk officer and AmBank’s board about Najib’s accounts

    The prosecution witness said Cheah was the only go-to person with direct access to Najib after having met the latter for the account opening forms

    Pointing out that the AmBank board was actually already aware of Najib’s accounts, Yu said her BBM messages on Najib’s accounts’ details being reported to the board were “just to get the account closed”, as Low had always insisted on strict confidentiality

    To Jho, the account he mentioned, strictly confidential, so I tried before to ask him to close the accounts and he kept saying no, Datuk Seri Najib doesn’t want to close

    Friday, 03 Feb 2023

    "So far, the ASF positive farms were at South Seberang Prai (18), Central Seberang Prai (2), North Seberang Prai (4) and the south-west district (3)," he said during a press conference at Komtar on Friday (Feb 3)

    Chow said the JPV has sent the application of reparations to Putrajaya for 10 pig farms that have completed its culling process

    He called on the public to remain calm as the ASF is not zoonotic and only infected pigs and wild boar

    He advised pig farmers and the public to immediately report any death relating to wild boars, village pigs or commercial pigs to the Penang JPV via the Disease Crisis Management Room hotline at 04-5041047.

  • STAFF SHORTAGE, PATIENT LOAD LED KLANG HOSPITAL TO CLOSE EMERGENCY DEPT GREEN ZONE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/03/staff-shortage-patient-load-led-klang-hospital-to-close-emergency-dept-green-zone

    02/03/2023, 14:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    Friday, 03 Feb 2023

    Sources from the hospital said that the green zone’s emergency department at HTAR was closed a second time this week for a duration of one shift or about seven hours

    It added that a change in the shift system would also be imposed from next week to accommodate the high patient load, where medical staff who are put on one night shift per week, are entitled to one night off but without any days off

    Others working two days of night shifts are entitled to one night off and one day off

    Meanwhile medical staff who are more than 34 weeks pregnant are exempted from the night shift and if given two days off, their working hours would be extended to 4pm, instead of 3.15pm

    Tengku Ampuan Rahimah Klang

    ['hospital', 'emergency', 'department', 'one', 'shift']

  • DR ZALIHA, MALAYSIA'S FIRST HEALTH MINISTER TO CHAIR WHO EXECUTIVE BOARD MEETING

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/03/dr-zaliha-malaysia039s-first-health-minister-to-chair-who-executive-board-meeting

    02/03/2023, 14:07

    53.85% Shortened!

    Health director-general Tan Sri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah said the honour was the first in the country’s history and throughout his 10 years of involvement with the WHO

    Dr Noor Hisham said Dr Zaliha was honoured to chair the meeting after being appointed as the vice-chairman of the WHO Executive Board representing the Western Pacific region for 2023-2024

    "This is the first time in the history of our Health Minister, Dr Zaliha Mustafa, to chair the 152nd Session of WHO Executive Board Meeting on poliomyelitis eradication, polio transition planning, and polio post-certification

    "This is one of the main achievements of Dr Zaliha who is on her first official visit abroad since being appointed as Health Minister,” he tweeted

    The WHO Executive Board meeting is a regular meeting attended by health ministers, directors-general and experts in the field of health

    WHO Executive Board Meeting

  • WORLD BANK RECOMMENDS MALAYSIA MOVE TOWARDS TARGETED SUBSIDIES, MORE TAXES IN PREPARATION OF DWINDLING COFFERS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/02/world-bank-recommends-malaysia-move-towards-targeted-subsidies-more-taxes-in-preparation-of-dwindling-coffers/53162

    02/03/2023, 12:08

    60.0% Shortened!

    The World Bank further recommended that Malaysia go ahead with its plans to reassess the country’s poverty line income and multidimensional poverty index

    The World Bank also said that Malaysia should increase its revenue collection, adding that the country has historically under collected in terms of personal and consumption taxes

    “Currently, the government’s fiscal consolidation projects government revenue to decline further from 15 per cent of GDP in 2023 to an average of 14.7 per cent in the medium term

    “With Malaysia’s revenue level remaining low and trailing comparative peers, it is important to address the persistent decline in revenue collection and explore new sources of revenue

    It added that the tax base for personal income tax could be broadened while the consumption tax framework could be “enhanced”

    The areas mentioned were digital infrastructure, digital platforms, digital financial services, digital literacy and advanced digital skills, as well as digital safeguards

    ['world', 'bank', 'malaysia', 'subsidy', 'say']

    The World Bank further recommended that Malaysia go ahead with its plans to reassess the country’s poverty line income and multidimensional poverty index

    The World Bank also said that Malaysia should increase its revenue collection, adding that the country has historically under collected in terms of personal and consumption taxes

    “Currently, the government’s fiscal consolidation projects government revenue to decline further from 15 per cent of GDP in 2023 to an average of 14.7 per cent in the medium term

    “With Malaysia’s revenue level remaining low and trailing comparative peers, it is important to address the persistent decline in revenue collection and explore new sources of revenue

    It added that the tax base for personal income tax could be broadened while the consumption tax framework could be “enhanced”

    The areas mentioned were digital infrastructure, digital platforms, digital financial services, digital literacy and advanced digital skills, as well as digital safeguards

  • WITH DIM OUTLOOK ON GLOBAL ECONOMY, WORLD BANK SAYS MALAYSIA’S GDP GROWTH RATE TO DROP TO 4.0PC THIS YEAR

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/02/with-dim-outlook-on-global-economy-world-bank-says-malaysias-gdp-growth-rate-to-drop-to-40pc-this-year/53148

    02/03/2023, 12:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 3 — Following an expected growth of 7.8 per cent in 2022, Malaysia’s economy is projected to grow at a “moderate pace” of 4.0 per cent this year, according to the World Bank

    In its “Malaysia Economic Monitor February 2023” report released today, the World Bank attributed the lower growth rate partly to a troubled global economy

    The World Bank previously announced that global economic growth is forecasted to decelerate sharply to 1.7 per cent in 2023, compared to a 2022 global growth rate of 2.8 per cent

    The report also said that in line with a less supportive global environment, Malaysia’s trade growth is expected to slow down to 2.2 per cent in 2023, while import growth is projected to drop to 2.1 per cent

    Furthermore, it said that government revenue is projected to decrease to 15 per cent of GDP this year — compared to the expected 16.7 per cent in 2022 — as crude oil prices come down

    The main factor that is expected to drive Malaysia’s economic growth this year is domestic private spending

    ['expect', 'growth', 'per', 'cent', 'malaysia']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 3 — Following an expected growth of 7.8 per cent in 2022, Malaysia’s economy is projected to grow at a “moderate pace” of 4.0 per cent this year, according to the World Bank

    In its “Malaysia Economic Monitor February 2023” report released today, the World Bank attributed the lower growth rate partly to a troubled global economy

    The World Bank previously announced that global economic growth is forecasted to decelerate sharply to 1.7 per cent in 2023, compared to a 2022 global growth rate of 2.8 per cent

    The report also said that in line with a less supportive global environment, Malaysia’s trade growth is expected to slow down to 2.2 per cent in 2023, while import growth is projected to drop to 2.1 per cent

    Furthermore, it said that government revenue is projected to decrease to 15 per cent of GDP this year — compared to the expected 16.7 per cent in 2022 — as crude oil prices come down

    The main factor that is expected to drive Malaysia’s economic growth this year is domestic private spending

    ['expect', 'growth', 'per', 'cent', 'malaysia']



  • GOOGLE WORKERS STAGE RALLIES AGAINST JOB CUTS, LOW WAGES

    https://www.thestar.com.my/tech/tech-news/2023/02/03/google-workers-stage-rallies-against-job-cuts-low-wages

    02/03/2023, 12:07

    70.0% Shortened!

    Friday, 03 Feb 2023

    Members of the Alphabet Workers Union (CWA) hold a rally outside the Google office in response to recent layoffs, in New York on Feb 2, 2023

    Google’s parent company Alphabet announced in January it will cut about 12,000 jobs globally, citing a changing economic reality

    Rallies, one held on Feb 1 at Google headquarters in Mountain View, California, and another on Feb 2 near Google’s corporate offices in New York City, came after the company announced the largest reduction in its history – 12,000 positions, or 6% of its global workforce

    The protest in New York, which drew about 50 employees outside a Google store on Ninth Avenue, began just minutes after parent company Alphabet Inc reported fourth-quarter results, including US$13.6 billion in profit

    lawsuit against Google could benefit Apple and others

    Members of the Alphabet Workers Union (CWA) hold a rally outside the Google office in response to recent layoffs, in New York on Feb 2, 2023

    Google’s parent company Alphabet announced in January it will cut about 12,000 jobs globally, citing a changing economic reality

    Rallies, one held on Feb 1 at Google headquarters in Mountain View, California, and another on Feb 2 near Google’s corporate offices in New York City, came after the company announced the largest reduction in its history – 12,000 positions, or 6% of its global workforce

    The protest in New York, which drew about 50 employees outside a Google store on Ninth Avenue, began just minutes after parent company Alphabet Inc reported fourth-quarter results, including US$13.6 billion in profit

    lawsuit against Google could benefit Apple and others

    ['feb', 'alphabet', 'worker', 'google', 'company']



  • DNB CONFIRMS 5G ACCESSIBLE IN 38% OF POPULATED AREAS IN MALAYSIA AFTER REBUKE OVER COVERAGE CLAIMS

    02/03/2023, 12:07

    66.67% Shortened!

    Once a site has been onboarded, it then becomes available to end users for all the MNOs that have executed the Access Agreement with DNB.” DNB added that they have noted a significant increase in on-air sites recently with onboarding averaging hundreds of sites a week, and the difference between integrated and on-air sites is narrowing as the network reaches more telco customers

    At the moment, DNB says its network is averaging 351Mbps download speeds against the average 4G download speed of 35Mbps

    During the previous JENDELA quarterly update, the MCMC reported that DNB has a total of 1,915 sites as of 30th September 2022

    Out of this figure, 1,070 sites have been onboarded with national 5G coverage of 33.2%

    DNB aims to achieve 80% 5G population coverage by the end of 2024 with a total of 7,509 sites

    According to the original plan, DNB was supposed to deliver 4,018 sites to achieve 40% 5G population coverage by the end of 2022

  • NETFLIX PASSWORD SHARING: HERE'S HOW NETFLIX CAN CRACK DOWN ON FREELOADERS

    https://soyacincau.com/2023/02/03/netflix-password-sharing-heres-how-netflix-can-crack-down-on-freeloaders/

    02/03/2023, 11:07

    71.43% Shortened!

    Specifically, Netflix will use information such as IP addresses, device IDs and account activity to determine if a device that’s signed into your account is being used at the account’s primary location

    For what it’s worth, Netflix now says that this was a mistake

    When checking the conditions set about by Netflix Malaysia, it states that a Netflix account is only for people who live in the same household together

    This means that they do not allow people who aren’t living in the same household as you to use your Netflix account

    “When a device outside of your household signs in to an account or is used persistently, we may ask you to verify that device before it can be used to watch Netflix or switch your Netflix household

    We do this to confirm that the device using the account is authorized to do so,” – Netflix Malaysia FAQ Netflix Malaysia then goes on to say if it does want to verify a device, it will send a link to the email address or the phone number linked to your Netflix account

    ['netflix', 'password', 'share', 'device', 'use']

    Each one was accompanied by two officers from the Metropolitan Police Bureau

    The bribe-taking charges carry a maximum sentence of life imprisonment and a fine of up to 400,000 baht

    Initially, the six policemen were charged with dereliction of duty for failing to take legal action against a group of tourists from Taiwan and Singapore who were found to be carrying vaping devices, which are illegal in Thailand

    The policemen intercepted Taiwanese actress Charlene An’s group at a checkpoint on Ratchadaphisek Road in the early hours of Jan 5

    Her allegations caught the attention of netizens in Taiwan and Thailand, prompting the Metropolitan Police Bureau to issue an order on Jan 26 to set up a fact-finding committee

  • US SAYS SIME DARBY PLANTATION PRODUCTS NO LONGER PRODUCED WITH FORCED LABOUR

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/03/us-says-sime-darby-plantation-products-no-longer-produced-with-forced-labour

    02/03/2023, 10:07

    64.71% Shortened!

    Goods made by Sime Darby Plantation, the world's largest palm oil company by land size, have been blocked by the US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) from entering the US since December 2020 over suspected abusive labour practices

    In response, Sime Darby Plantation appointed an ethical trade consultancy to audit its facilities, and last year set aside about $20mil to compensate current and former migrant workers who paid recruitment fees to secure jobs at the firm

    Federal Register website on Thursday, CBP said it had now "determined that the products were no longer being mined, produced, or manufactured wholly or in part with the use of convict, forced, or indentured labor by Sime Darby Plantation", citing additional information it had received

    Sime Darby said it was aware of the US notice

    Shares of Sime Darby Plantation eased 0.5% on Friday morning

    Sime Darby Plantation is among eight Malaysian firms that have been banned by the United States in the past four years over forced labour allegations

    ['united', 'state', 'say', 'sime', 'darby']

    Goods made by Sime Darby Plantation, the world's largest palm oil company by land size, have been blocked by the US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) from entering the US since December 2020 over suspected abusive labour practices

    Federal Register website on Thursday, CBP said it had now "determined that the products were no longer being mined, produced, or manufactured wholly or in part with the use of convict, forced, or indentured labor by Sime Darby Plantation", citing additional information it had received

    ‘Fever so high you feel like blacking out’ One parent, Ms Carol Loo, a 42-year-old financial consultant, said that her nine-year-old daughter fell sick over the first weekend of Chinese New Year, which began on Jan 22 this year

    Her daughter began running a high fever of 40°C on Chinese New Year’s eve, followed by her two-year-old son two days later

    Ms Loo, her 28-year-old domestic worker, and her 60-year-old mother then started becoming ill, first with a fever and then other flu symptoms such as a cough and sore throat

    Her son, a Primary 2 student at Nanyang Primary School, fell sick two days after a school-wide Chinese New Year celebration

    Between Jan 15 and 21 this year, the week before Chinese New Year, the average daily polyclinic attendance for acute upper respiratory infections was 2,405 cases

    “Flu infections are very common during winter and monsoon seasons at the end of the year

  • YOURSAY | ARTICLES ON CHINESE SCHOOLS' TRUTH OR FICTITIOUS?

    https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/653785

    02/03/2023, 09:07

    84.62% Shortened!

    That'd be a mighty huge coincidence to randomly interview two students in the same school named after two heroes of the same saga, and bearing two-word Chinese names, which is a rarity in Malaysia

    So, I don't doubt the headline, but people familiar with Chinese literature and Chinese history will be quick to notice the oddity of the two students interviewed and question the motives of the article

    If most around you are of Chinese descent, then Mandarin would be the main language

    So according to your logic, which no doubt Einstein, Aristotle, and Mat Kilau would envy, the two articles were not seditious, it was just that the title would cause something called “kegusaran” or public alarm

    Only in Malaysia, folks, only in Malaysia

    I am sceptical of the veracity of the article

    ['two', 'student', 'name', 'article', 'chinese']

    Other group companies also lost further ground, with 10% losses at Adani Total Gas, Adani Green Energy and Adani Transmission, while Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone shed nearly 7%

    Adani Enterprises - described as an incubator of Adani's businesses - has lost $26 billion in market capitalisation

    CLSA estimates that Indian banks were exposed to about 40% of the $24.5 billion of Adani Group debt in the fiscal year to March 2022

    However, he pointed out that Bersatu did not make public its accounts, but the matter was exposed by the MACC

  • QUICKCHECK: WERE THE 272 STEPS GOING UP BATU CAVES ORIGINALLY MADE OF WOOD?

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/true-or-not/2023/02/03/quickcheck-were-the-272-steps-going-up-batu-caves-originally-made-of-wood

    02/03/2023, 08:09

    60.0% Shortened!

    THE first Thaipusam festival in Batu Caves was celebrated in 1892 and it continues to this day attracting close to a million visitors every year

    Devotees following the procession now have to walk up 272 concrete steps to reach the cave

    Prior to that, devotees had to scale the hill to reach the temple within the cave

    These were ready by 1940 and the same steps have been part of the temple ever since

    Batu Caves was first promoted as a place of worship by K

    Batu Caves is made up of several caves with the largest and most famous one being the Temple Cave as it houses several Hindu shrines

    ['first', 'thaipusam', 'batu', 'cave', 'step']

  • NEW WAY TO EASE CAUSEWAY TRAFFIC

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/03/new-way-to-ease-causeway-traffic

    02/03/2023, 08:08

    64.71% Shortened!

    Johor works, transportation and infrastructure committee chairman Mohamad Fazli Mohamad Salleh said under this system, clearance would only be done on either side of the border once

    “This means Singapore’s immigration officers will be stationed at our checkpoints in Johor to clear people entering the republic, while Malaysian immigration personnel will be deployed in Singapore to clear those entering Malaysia

    This will be similar to the system that will be used when the Rapid Transit System operations begin in 2026,” he told The Star.During the recent visit of Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim to Singapore, Johor Mentri Besar Datuk Onn Hafiz Ghazi had appealed for the traffic situation at the Causeway, one of the world’s busiest land crossings, to be brought under control, saying that regular commuters, numbering about 150,000, were being greatly inconvenienced

    Mohamad Fazli, who heads a multi-agency taskforce looking into easing congestion at the Causeway and Second Link in Tuas, said Johor was also seeking additional funds to increase motorcycle lanes from 50 to 75 each way

    Loganathan, 48, said there seemed to be more congestion on the Singapore side due to a lack of personnel at the Woodlands checkpoint

    Motorcyclist Omar Kamison, 35, proposed a dedicated motorcycle lane at the Second Link for people arriving from Singapore

    ['johor', 'system', 'traffic', 'causeway', 'singapore']

  • JHO LOW'S DENIAL 'SURPRISING'

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/03/jho-lows-denial-surprising

    02/03/2023, 08:08

    66.67% Shortened!

    Joanna Yu, the 41st prosecution witness in the RM2.28bil 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) graft trial, has consistently told the High Court that she dealt with Low, better known as Jho Low, to get instructions on Najib’s accounts

    Low’s denial was brought up by Najib’s lead counsel Tan Sri Muhammad Shafee Abdullah here at the High Court yesterday

    The defence previously contended that Low was the “mastermind” behind the 1MDB scandal while Yu had testified before that she would receive instructions from Low on managing Najib’s bank accounts whenever she could not get hold of Nik Faisal Ariff Kamil, who was the mandate holder of the accounts

    The witness said she was unsure how the questions were posed to Low by the MACC

    Yu also denied receiving any bribes from Low, particularly an iPhone 5s

    She testified that Low had offered the phone to her, but she declined with the excuse that she did not want or need a phone

    ['najib', 'say', 'surprised', 'low', 'jho']

    Joanna Yu, the 41st prosecution witness in the RM2.28bil 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) graft trial, has consistently told the High Court that she dealt with Low, better known as Jho Low, to get instructions on Najib’s accounts

    Low’s denial was brought up by Najib’s lead counsel Tan Sri Muhammad Shafee Abdullah here at the High Court yesterday

    The defence previously contended that Low was the “mastermind” behind the 1MDB scandal while Yu had testified before that she would receive instructions from Low on managing Najib’s bank accounts whenever she could not get hold of Nik Faisal Ariff Kamil, who was the mandate holder of the accounts

  • MILITARY PLACES RESTIVE AREAS OF MYANMAR UNDER MARTIAL LAW

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/myanmar-declares-martial-law-regions-states-military-coup-3250176

    02/03/2023, 08:07

    66.67% Shortened!

    In this photo released from the military The Military True News Information Team, Myint Swe, acting President of the military government, attends the National Defense and Security Council meeting on Jan 31, 2023, in Naypyitaw, Myanmar

    State-run MRTV television broadcast an announcement by Aung Lin Dwe, secretary of the military’s State Administration Council, imposing martial law in 37 townships across eight of the country’s 14 regions and states

    The military has declared martial law before, most notably in early 2021 in Yangon, the country’s biggest city, after which violence escalated against protesters

    Aung Lin Dwe said in a statement that it was necessary to declare martial law to effectively carry out security and the rule of law

    Martial law supersedes all other laws, giving the military total authority over a specified area, including administrative, judicial and law enforcement functions

    A major reshuffle of the Cabinet and the military’s more powerful State Administration Council was also announced on Wednesday.

    ['military', 'news', 'martial', 'law', 'declare']

    The military has declared martial law before, most notably in early 2021 in Yangon, the country’s biggest city, after which violence escalated against protesters

  • MALAYSIA FALLS ONE NOTCH IN GLOBAL DEMOCRACY RANKING, STILL BRANDED ‘FLAWED DEMOCRACY’

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/03/malaysia-falls-one-notch-in-global-democracy-ranking-still-branded-flawed-democracy/53072

    02/03/2023, 08:07

    75.0% Shortened!

    The EIU assigns “full democracy” status to countries that score 8 and above, while those between 7.99 to 5.99 as “flawed democracy”

    The index scores a country using five benchmarks that look at how fair and plural elections are, the functioning of a government, political participation, political culture and civil liberties

    Political participation in the country is also fairly decent although still far below the US and Israel, at 7.22

    “Asia and Australasia’s regional score in the Democracy Index stands at 5.46 in 2022, unchanged from the previous year

    “However, deterioration began before the pandemic, with the region’s score having declined steadily since a peak in 2014-15

    This comes as the average global score in the index rose from 5.28 in 2021 to 5.29, as the lifting of pandemic restrictions boosted the score in many countries

    ['democracy', 'score', 'civil', 'liberty', 'region']

    The EIU assigns “full democracy” status to countries that score 8 and above, while those between 7.99 to 5.99 as “flawed democracy”

    The index scores a country using five benchmarks that look at how fair and plural elections are, the functioning of a government, political participation, political culture and civil liberties

    Political participation in the country is also fairly decent although still far below the US and Israel, at 7.22

    “Asia and Australasia’s regional score in the Democracy Index stands at 5.46 in 2022, unchanged from the previous year

    “However, deterioration began before the pandemic, with the region’s score having declined steadily since a peak in 2014-15

    This comes as the average global score in the index rose from 5.28 in 2021 to 5.29, as the lifting of pandemic restrictions boosted the score in many countries

    ['democracy', 'score', 'civil', 'liberty', 'region']

    Amendments to the Wildlife Conservation Act will provide for stiffer penalties of up to a RM1mil fine, and 15 years’ jail for those caught smuggling protected wildlife

    Amendments to the Wildlife Conservation Act, which came into effect on Wednesday, would provide for stiffer penalties of up to a RM1mil fine and 15 years in jail for those caught smuggling protected wildlife

    “We hope they continue tackling it with fervour to end the loss of our wildlife,” she added

    She also said that an emphasis on the importance of wildlife preservation and the harsh penalties for illegal wildlife smuggling should be part of the school curriculum

    “The Communications and Digital Ministry must also crack down on the online black market for wildlife parts and products

    These online markets play a major role in the illegal wildlife trade in Malaysia,” he said

    The Menu Rahmah programme was made possible with the cooperation of the Malaysian Indian Restaurant Owners’ Association, Malaysian Muslim Restaurant Owners Association, Malaysian Tomyam Operators Association, Malaysian Singapore Coffee Shop Proprietors General Association, Bumiputera Retailers Organisation, Malaysia Retail Chain Association and Malaysia Retailers Association.

  • STOCKS MOVING IN AFTER-HOURS: AMAZON, ALPHABET, APPLE

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/stocks-moving-in-after-hours-amazon-alphabet-apple-225318178.html

    60.0% Shortened!

    Amazon (AMZN) The online giant's net sales $149.20 billion for the fourth quarter came in above analyst expectations of $149.20 billion

    Operating income came in at $2.74 billion, beating analyst expectations of $2.51 billion

    The tech giant reported fourth quarter sales, excluding partner payouts, of $63.1 billion versus analyst expectations of $63.2 billion

    Apple (AAPL) Shares fell about 4% in after hours after the tech giant's quarterly revenue of $117.15 billion declined by 5% year-over-year, missing analyst expectations of $121.14

    iPhone sales dropped 8% year-over-year to $65.8 billion, missing estimates of $68.3 billion

    Ines is a senior business reporter for Yahoo Finance

    ['billion', 'come', 'expectation', 'year', 'yahoo']

    “The treasury will make its cost estimate before the tender is open

    If they want to avoid the open tender system, the reason must be justified, he said

    Economist Tan Sri Ramon Navaratnam said the open tender system is best if it is done in a transparent and accountable manner

    In a closed system those involved can get “a few friends” to bid for the tender before it is awarded to one of them

    “Before a bid is awarded in an open tender system, all bidders must be carefully scrutinised to ensure the winner can deliver

  • 2 REASONS META STOCK IS EXPLODING 20% AFTER A WHOPPER EARNINGS MISS

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/why-meta-stock-is-jumping-earnings-results-miss-111907549.html

    80.0% Shortened!

    Except if you are Meta (META)

    The company had the most visited ticker page on Yahoo Finance

    Q4 Revenue – $32.17 billion actual versus $31.65 billion expected Advertising Revenue – $31.25 billion actual versus $30.86 billion expected Adjusted Earnings Per Share (EPS) – $1.76 actual versus $2.26 expected Facebook Daily Active Users (DAUs) – 2 billion actual versus 1.98 billion expected Family of Apps Daily Active Users (DAUs) – 2.96 billion actual versus 2.92 billion expected Reality Labs Operating Loss – -$4.28 billion actual versus -$3.99 billion expected Investors have long loved Meta for its ability to print money but soured on the name in 2022 amid slowing sales and fresh restructuring efforts

    The company then went onto slash its expense and capex guidance for the year by $5 billion and $4 billion, respectively

    Meta unveiled a new $40 billion stock buyback authorization, giving it $50 billion total capacity

    We don't suggest other companies go down the route of Meta and miss on earnings estimates

    Except if you are Meta (META)

    The company had the most visited ticker page on Yahoo Finance

    Q4 Revenue – $32.17 billion actual versus $31.65 billion expected Advertising Revenue – $31.25 billion actual versus $30.86 billion expected Adjusted Earnings Per Share (EPS) – $1.76 actual versus $2.26 expected Facebook Daily Active Users (DAUs) – 2 billion actual versus 1.98 billion expected Family of Apps Daily Active Users (DAUs) – 2.96 billion actual versus 2.92 billion expected Reality Labs Operating Loss – -$4.28 billion actual versus -$3.99 billion expected Investors have long loved Meta for its ability to print money but soured on the name in 2022 amid slowing sales and fresh restructuring efforts

    The company then went onto slash its expense and capex guidance for the year by $5 billion and $4 billion, respectively

    Meta unveiled a new $40 billion stock buyback authorization, giving it $50 billion total capacity

    We don't suggest other companies go down the route of Meta and miss on earnings estimates

    ['earnings', 'meta', 'company', 'yahoo', 'finance']

    GM also hit the top end of its full-year 2022 EBIT forecast, and also guided its full-year 2023 higher than analysts were expecting, seeing $11.5 billion in EBIT this year

    Last quarter Ford reiterated its full year 2022 EBIT forecast of $11.5 billion, and investors will be on the lookout for where 2023 guidance will land

    The consensus estimate for Ford’s 2023 EBIT is around $10 billion

    — Pras Subramanian is a reporter for Yahoo Finance

    You can follow him on Twitter and on Instagram

    As advertising fell year-over-year

    This is also the first time Alphabet will report earnings since the Department of Justice (DOJ) filed an antitrust lawsuit against the tech giant over its advertising business

  • NANCY SHUKRI CHIDES KAJANG COPS FOR DENYING WOMAN ACCESS TO STATION OVER ATTIRE

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/02/nancy-shukri-chides-kajang-cops-for-denying-woman-access-to-station-over-attire/53170

    02/03/2023

    45.45% Shortened!

    She said the Iris programme, on the other hand, focused on conveying information and sharing knowledge about women’s rights from legal aspects, proper complaint channels and assistance provided to victims of violence and discrimination

    Meanwhile, commenting on a news report involving a woman who claimed that she was denied entry into a police station because she was wearing shorts, Nancy said there should be no discrimination against any party

    She said it was understood that the woman went to the police station to lodge a report after being involved in an accident

    “It is inappropriate to deny access to any individuals to a police station regardless of how they dress,” she said

    Kajang district police chief ACP Mohd Zaid Hassan, in a statement said that the woman, in her 30s, was wearing a pair of shorts which did not cover her knees when she came to the Kajang police headquarters

    He said the woman was later asked to change into something more appropriate, in line with the dressing etiquette set for government premises, if she wanted to deal with the police

    ['ngo', 'information', 'domestic', 'violence', 'woman']

  • CHINA BECOMES ISRAEL'S LARGEST SUPPLIER OF IMPORTED PASSENGER CARS IN JAN.

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2023/02/03/china-becomes-israel039s-largest-supplier-of-imported-passenger-cars-in-jan

    02/03/2023, 05:07

    50.0% Shortened!

    Friday, 03 Feb 2023

    2 (Xinhua) -- China became Israel's largest supplier of imported passenger cars in January, according to figures released by the Israel Vehicle Importers Association on Thursday

    A total of 7,753 Chinese passenger cars were sold in Israel in January, up from 685 in the same month last year

    With nearly 3,000 units sold in Israel in January, the electric subcompact crossover model Atto 3, which was manufactured by China's BYD Auto and began sales in Israel in Oct

    2022, was the best-selling electric car in Israel in January

    The gasoline-powered models of the Chinese automaker Chery, which were introduced to Israel in November 2022, and the electric models of MG and Geely, also registered high sales in Israel in January.

    ['israel', 'passenger', 'car', 'january', 'sell']

    Friday, 03 Feb 2023

    2 (Xinhua) -- China became Israel's largest supplier of imported passenger cars in January, according to figures released by the Israel Vehicle Importers Association on Thursday

    With nearly 3,000 units sold in Israel in January, the electric subcompact crossover model Atto 3, which was manufactured by China's BYD Auto and began sales in Israel in Oct

    2022, was the best-selling electric car in Israel in January

    The gasoline-powered models of the Chinese automaker Chery, which were introduced to Israel in November 2022, and the electric models of MG and Geely, also registered high sales in Israel in January.

  • ARK’S CATHIE WOOD PREDICTS THESE INNOVATIONS WILL SOAR 40% IN VALUE EVERY YEAR TO OVER $200 TRILLION BY 2030

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/ark-cathie-wood-predicts-innovations-134909701.html

    71.43% Shortened!

    “The market value associated with disruptive innovation could account for the majority of the global equity market capitalization,” the report concluded

    Wood’s team identifies 14 distinct technologies they believe will feed off each other, broadly converging into five overarching investment themes ("innovation platforms") grouped around artificial intelligence, robotics, energy storage, public blockchains and the multi-omic sequencing of digitalized biological data

    These artificial brains, which power innovations like OpenAI’s ChatGPT, could quadruple the productivity of knowledge workers by the end of the decade, according to ARK Invest

    “Breakthroughs associated with energy storage and robotics alone could add 30% to real GDP by 2030,” it wrote, “and AI could dwarf both their contributions.” Wood is something of a tech guru who is notable for her early, accurate predictions of Tesla's extraordinary bull run that once earned it a $1 trillion valuation towards the tail end of 2021

    Wood borrows so heavily from it in her research that it features a very own web page on her ARK Invest site

    But Woods is known to favor companies like Tesla that offer exposure to several different disruptive innovations at once, such as electric vehicles, energy storage, robotics and artificial intelligence

    ['could', 'wood', 'ark', 'invest', 'technology']

  • CATHIE WOOD POURS MILLIONS INTO THESE 2 STOCKS — THIS IS WHAT MAKES THEM ATTRACTIVE BUYS

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/cathie-wood-pours-millions-2-144804241.html

    86.67% Shortened!

    (BEAM) The first Wood-backed stock we’ll look at is Beam Therapeutics, a pioneer in the application of base editing

    Meanwhile, Cathie Wood has been adding more BEAM shares to the ARKG ETF

    “In 2023, we expect two key updates from Beam’s partner Verve to drive upside in BEAM

    Beam’s partner Verve is utilizing Beam’s base editing technology in its lead program (VERVE-101) for in vivo gene editing

    For 4Q22, CareDx anticipates record revenues between $81.9 million to $82.2 million, amounting to a year-over-year increase of roughly 4%

    For the full-year, revenue is expected to grow by ~8% to the range between $321.3 million and $321.6 million (consensus has $321.09 million)

    ['year', 'wood', 'edit', 'share', 'stock']

    Meanwhile, Cathie Wood has been adding more BEAM shares to the ARKG ETF

    “In 2023, we expect two key updates from Beam’s partner Verve to drive upside in BEAM

    Beam’s partner Verve is utilizing Beam’s base editing technology in its lead program (VERVE-101) for in vivo gene editing

    For 4Q22, CareDx anticipates record revenues between $81.9 million to $82.2 million, amounting to a year-over-year increase of roughly 4%

  • AMAZON EARNINGS PREVIEW: ANALYSTS ARE WATCHING MARGINS, CLOUD BUSINESS

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/amazon-earnings-preview-analysts-are-watching-margins-cloud-business-150219192.html

    76.0% Shortened!

    Amazon (AMZN) is set to report its Q4 2022 earnings on Feb

    This round of earnings will also tie up the year in which a unionization push at Amazon fully materialized

    Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a stalwart of the Seattle-based company's business, a cloud giant that's long been a reliable source of revenue and growth for the company

    However, Microsoft's (MSFT) gloomy earnings call last week – in which the company predicted cloud growth would decelerate – indicates that cloud growth at Amazon could also viably be slowing down

    Analysts are also hoping to see some retail growth that demonstrates the resilience of Amazon's e-commerce business

    As the company's headcount is being slashed, Kessler also expects to see the company's could save Amazon on its operating expenses – though we may not start to see the effects of those job cuts just yet

    ['amazon', 'earnings', 'company', 'year', 'expect']

  • HOW MAN UTD LINED UP LAST TIME THEY WON 12 HOME GAMES IN A ROW AS ERIK TEN HAG TURNS OLD TRAFFORD INTO...

    https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/21252431/man-utd-line-up-winning-run-ten-hag/

    02/03/2023, 00:07

    76.0% Shortened!

    MAN UTD'S 2-0 win over Nottingham Forest on Wednesday evening was their 12th home victory in a row in all competitions

    It is a run that has seen Erik ten Hag's men move into the top four in the Premier League table, reach the fifth round of the FA Cup and the final of the Carabao Cup

    The last time Man Utd won 12 or more home matches on the spin during a single season was a run of form from December 2010 to May 2011

    Their home games after the weekend then come against Leeds, Leicester and Barcelona

    "The Sun", "Sun", "Sun Online" are registered trademarks or trade names of News Group Newspapers Limited

    To see all content on The Sun, please use the Site Map

    ['man', 'win', 'home', 'league', 'charge']

    MAN UTD'S 2-0 win over Nottingham Forest on Wednesday evening was their 12th home victory in a row in all competitions

    It is a run that has seen Erik ten Hag's men move into the top four in the Premier League table, reach the fifth round of the FA Cup and the final of the Carabao Cup

    The last time Man Utd won 12 or more home matches on the spin during a single season was a run of form from December 2010 to May 2011

    Their home games after the weekend then come against Leeds, Leicester and Barcelona

    "The Sun", "Sun", "Sun Online" are registered trademarks or trade names of News Group Newspapers Limited

    To see all content on The Sun, please use the Site Map

    ['man', 'win', 'home', 'league', 'charge']

  • I SELL FOOD TO SUPPORT MY THREE SONS, SAYS EMILIA

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/02/i-sell-food-to-support-my-three-sons-says-emilia

    02/02/2023, 21:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    Thursday, 02 Feb 2023

    Emilia Hanafi, 43, said that she chose to work part-time because she had to manage the schooling of her three sons, aged 17, 12 and 10, including dropping them off and fetching them from school

    The seventh prosecution witness told the court that she took up a part-time job to support the family, including her three sons, for whom the interim maintenance of RM2,000 received for each child was insufficient

    Emilia testified on Thursday, after the court allowed the application of lawyer, Datuk Akberdin Abdul Kader, who represented SM Faisal, for Emilia to be called to testify despite objection from the prosecution

    DPP Zahida Zakaria, however, informed the court that she would file a revision application against the court's order for Emilia to testify on Thursday

    Thursday’s hearing was supposed to proceed with the sixth prosecution witness, Elisa Nani, who is Emilia's younger sister, to be cross-examined by the lawyer, but Akberdin applied for Emilia be called to testify first, because she is an important witness for the prosecution

    ['thursday', 'faisal', 'emilia', 'court', 'child']

  • THAIPUSAM: POLICE EXPECT TWO MILLION PEOPLE TO THRONG BATU CAVES, SEVEN ROADS CLOSED

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/02/thaipusam-police-expect-two-million-people-to-throng-batu-caves-seven-roads-closed/53135

    02/02/2023, 20:08

    60.0% Shortened!

    Seven roads around the Batu Caves temple will be closed from midnight tonight (February 3) until February 8

    The seven roads are the Kampung Melayu Batu Caves traffic light junction, the Middle Ring Road 2 turn off to the Batu Caves Temple and the traffic light junction in front of the Shell Batu Caves petrol station,” he said at a press conference here today

    The roads include Jalan Sultan Azlan Shah (both ways) from the Sentul IPD traffic light intersection to the Jalan Perhentian traffic light intersection, and the same stretch between 6pm and midnight on February 6

    Ipoh district police chief ACP Yahaya Hassan said this includes the period when Kavadi bearers go from the Sri Maha Mariamman temple in Jalan Sungai Pari, Buntong to the Sri Subramaniar temple in Gunung Cheroh, Jalan Raja Musa Aziz through the city on Sunday from 6am to midnight

    The first phase of road closures and traffic diversions will take place from 6pm tomorrow until 12.30am on Saturday during the chariot procession from the Sri Maha Mariamman temple to the Sri Subramaniar temple

    Among the routes involved in the chariot procession are Jalan Sungai Pari, Jalan Tun Perak, Jalan Lahat, Jalan Sultan Yusoff, Jalan Sultan Iskandar, Jalan Sultan Idris Shah, Jalan Laxamana, Jalan Raja Musa Aziz, Jalan Raja Ekram, Jalan Dato’ Onn Jaafar, Jalan Dato’ Ahmad Said, the hospital roundabout and Jalan Perhentian

    ['batu', 'cave', 'say', 'traffic', 'jalan']

  • PM ANWAR UNVEILS MALAYSIA MADANI LOGO

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/02/pm-anwar-unveils-malaysia-madani-logo

    02/02/2023, 19:07

    57.14% Shortened!

    The five fingers with red and white stripes highlighted in the logo symbolise the principles of Rukun Negara, the foundation of Malaysia’s ideology, while the blue circle on the ‘palm’ signifies consensus and unity among Malaysians

    The crescent moon symbol which represents Islam as the religion of the Federation, is also used as one of the elements of the logo, in addition to the 14-point star which signifies unity among the 13 states and Federal Territories of the Federation

    The four colors used for the logo are blue, symbolising national unity, inclusivity and brotherhood; red (courage, identity and determination); yellow (value of tradition, culture and local wisdom); and white (nobleness, purity of heart and goodwill)

    Anwar in the same posting said Malaysia Madani was proposed by him as the way forward for Malaysia as well as its multiracial and multicultural society

    The concept, which he introduced officially on Jan 19, was based on six pillars, namely sustainability, prosperity, innovation, respect, trust and compassion.- Bernama Saya mengusulkan Malaysia MADANI sebagai jalan ke depan untuk Malaysia serta masyarakatnya yang rencam kaum dan budaya

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['anwar', 'logo', 'malaysia', 'madani', 'post']

    The five fingers with red and white stripes highlighted in the logo symbolise the principles of Rukun Negara, the foundation of Malaysia’s ideology, while the blue circle on the ‘palm’ signifies consensus and unity among Malaysians

    The crescent moon symbol which represents Islam as the religion of the Federation, is also used as one of the elements of the logo, in addition to the 14-point star which signifies unity among the 13 states and Federal Territories of the Federation

    The four colors used for the logo are blue, symbolising national unity, inclusivity and brotherhood; red (courage, identity and determination); yellow (value of tradition, culture and local wisdom); and white (nobleness, purity of heart and goodwill)

    Anwar in the same posting said Malaysia Madani was proposed by him as the way forward for Malaysia as well as its multiracial and multicultural society

    The concept, which he introduced officially on Jan 19, was based on six pillars, namely sustainability, prosperity, innovation, respect, trust and compassion.- Bernama Saya mengusulkan Malaysia MADANI sebagai jalan ke depan untuk Malaysia serta masyarakatnya yang rencam kaum dan budaya

  • 1MDB TRIAL: WITNESS SURPRISED AT JHO LOW'S DENIAL OVER COMMUNICATION ON MANAGING NAJIB'S AMBANK ACCOUNTS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/02/1mdb-trial-witness-surprised-at-jho-low039s-denial-over-communication-on-managing-najib039s-ambank-accounts

    02/02/2023, 18:09

    66.67% Shortened!

    Thursday, 02 Feb 2023

    Joanna Yu, who is the 41st prosecution witness in the RM2.28bil 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) graft trial involving Najib, has consistently told the High Court that she dealt with Low, or better known as Jho Low, to get instructions on Najib's accounts

    Low's denial was brought up by Najib's lead counsel Tan Sri Muhammad Shafee Abdullah here at the High Court on Thursday (Feb 2)

    The defence has previously contended that Low was the "mastermind" behind the 1MDB scandal while Yu testified before that she would receive instructions from Low on managing Najib's bank account whenever she could not get hold of Nik Faisal Ariff Kamil, who is the mandate holder to Najib's bank accounts

    The witness said she was unsure how the questions were posed to Low by the MACC

    The witness also said she had rejected job offers from Low several times because she did not want to work according to Low's lifestyle

    ['najib', 'say', 'low', 'account', '1mdb']
